title: Implementing Dark Mode with CSS
excerpt: Add dark mode support with CSS media queries.
content:
Introduction

Add dark mode support with CSS media queries.

Building great web experiences requires attention to detail and an understanding of modern best practices. Implementing Dark Mode with CSS is essential for creating fast, accessible, and maintainable websites.

Core Concepts

The web platform provides powerful APIs and features. Understanding implementing dark mode with css helps you leverage these effectively for better user experiences.

Modern browsers support increasingly sophisticated features, making it easier than ever to build rich web applications without heavy frameworks.

Implementation

Here's how to implement these techniques:

/* CSS for dark-mode-css */
.component {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit, minmax(300px, 1fr));
  gap: 1.5rem;
  container-type: inline-size;
}

@container (min-width: 400px) {
  .component__item {
    display: flex;
    align-items: center;
  }
}

This approach provides responsive behavior while keeping the code maintainable.

Performance Considerations

When implementing implementing dark mode with css, consider these performance aspects:

  • Minimize render-blocking resources
  • Optimize images and media
  • Use efficient CSS selectors
  • Leverage browser caching

Accessibility

Ensure your implementation is accessible:

  • Use semantic HTML elements
  • Provide sufficient color contrast
  • Support keyboard navigation
  • Include appropriate ARIA attributes when needed

Browser Support

Check current browser support for features you use. Progressive enhancement ensures your site works for everyone while providing enhanced experiences for modern browsers.

Conclusion

Implementing Dark Mode with CSS is a valuable technique for modern web development. By following these guidelines, you'll create better experiences for your users.
